text: Frances McDormand gave a rousing speech demanding gender parity in the entertainment industry while accepting the Oscar for Best Actress at tonight's Academy Awards. While receiving the statue for her role in Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri, McDormand asked every female nominee inside the Dolby Theatre to stand with her in solidarity. Then, she implored industry bigshots to pay attention to female talent. ` ` We all have stories to tell and projects we need financed,'' she said. ` ` Don't talk to us about it at the parties tonight.
